newsitem.title: AFGHANISTAN: Afghan Ariana Airlines to fly to Islamabad.
newsitem.headline: Afghan Ariana Airlines to fly to Islamabad.

text.p: Afghanistan's state-owned Ariana Airlines will open flights between the capital Kabul and the Pakistan capital of Islamabad, official Radio Afghanistan said on Tuesday.
It said a protocol was signed on Monday between the Taleban-appointed deputy minister of civil aviation, whose name was not given, and representatives of the Pakistan government.
It said the flights would start soon, but did not give further details. The Islamic Taleban movement took control of Kabul last month.

Ariana, badly hit by the country's civil war, has maintained a sporadic domestic service and international flights to Delhi and Dubai. It evacuated two of its Boeing 727 airliners on Sunday after ousted government forces rocketed Kabul airport.
